test_sync: This field should be added to all JSONs
_setup_instructions: IMPORTANT SETUP INSTRUCTIONS: 1. Replace all placeholder values marked with ${...}. 2. For each question in your assessment, add a corresponding category in questionRecommendations. 3. Ensure primaryCategory is set to your main scoring category. 4. Use the question's category name exactly as it appears in the questions section. 5. Each question should contribute to both its own category score and the primaryCategory score. 6. The paths in nextRoute should include the assessment ID (e.g., '/survey/your-assessment-id'). 7. Use Title Case for category names (e.g., 'Stress Management', not 'stress_management' or 'stress-management'). 8. Make sure the same category name format is used consistently in the 'category' field, scores object, and questionRecommendations section. 9. Remove this _setup_instructions field when done.

intro.title: Agile Leadership Assessment
intro.subtitle: Evaluate if your teams would benefit from agile leadership training

instructions.title: How to Complete This Assessment
steps: Answer each question based on your observations of leadership approaches
Consider patterns across your entire organization or team
Focus on how leaders handle change, decision-making, and team empowerment
Select the option that best describes typical leadership approaches

columns.title: Agile Leadership Framework
columns.content: Developing the mindset and practices needed to lead effectively in fast-paced, constantly changing environments

points.description: How leaders approach uncertainty and changing conditions
How leaders delegate authority and build autonomous teams
How leaders foster learning and iterative development
How leaders prioritize customer value and outcomes

intro.consentText: I understand that this assessment will help determine if agile leadership training would benefit our organization

items.text: How do your leaders typically respond to unexpected changes or disruptions?

options.text: Often resist change and struggle to adapt plans
Accept change reluctantly but have difficulty adjusting strategies
Adapt to change adequately but could improve flexibility
Generally embrace change and adjust plans accordingly
View change as opportunity and quickly pivot strategies when needed

items.text: How do leaders in your organization approach decision-making authority?

options.text: Centralize most decisions and require approvals for minor matters
Delegate limited decisions but maintain control over important matters
Share decision-making sometimes but could improve team autonomy
Often empower teams but occasionally step in unnecessarily
Fully empower teams with appropriate decision-making authority

items.text: How do leaders approach learning and improvement in your organization?

options.text: Rarely examine past performance or implement lessons learned
Occasionally review performance but seldom make meaningful changes
Conduct regular reviews but could improve follow-through on insights
Regularly reflect on performance and often implement improvements
Consistently foster a culture of experimentation and systematic improvement

items.text: How do your leaders prioritize work and initiatives?

options.text: Based primarily on internal preferences without clear value criteria
Occasionally consider customer value but often focus on output metrics
Balance customer needs with internal priorities but could improve focus
Usually prioritize based on customer value and outcomes
Consistently prioritize based on customer impact and measure value delivered

items.text: How transparent are leaders about goals, challenges, and decision-making?

options.text: Information is closely guarded and teams often work without context
Share limited information on a need-to-know basis
Communicate major decisions but could be more open about challenges
Generally transparent but occasionally withhold certain information
Maintain high transparency about goals, challenges, and decision rationale

items.text: How do leaders in your organization approach cross-functional collaboration?

options.text: Work primarily in silos with minimal cross-team coordination
Allow some collaboration but maintain rigid departmental boundaries
Support cross-functional work but could reduce organizational barriers
Often facilitate cross-team collaboration and remove most obstacles
Actively promote fluid collaboration and organize around value delivery

items.text: How connected are your leaders to customer needs and feedback?

options.text: Rarely interact with customers or consider their feedback
Occasionally review customer data but decisions are primarily internal
Consider customer feedback but could improve direct engagement
Regularly seek customer input and use it to inform decisions
Deeply understand customers and build continuous feedback loops

items.text: How do leaders in your organization approach risk and uncertainty?

options.text: Highly risk-averse, requiring extensive planning before action
Hesitant to proceed without certainty and detailed analysis
Balance risk assessment with action but could improve adaptability
Generally comfortable with calculated risks and experimentation
Embrace uncertainty through iterative approaches and rapid learning

base: Focus on developing an agile mindset before implementing specific practices
Build a culture of psychological safety to enable experimentation
Ensure leaders model the behaviors they wish to see in their teams
Very High Need: Consider an executive workshop on agile leadership principles
Implement regular leadership retrospectives to identify improvement opportunities
Partner leaders with agile coaches for personalized development
Create clear metrics for measuring leadership effectiveness in agility
High Need: Provide training on servant leadership and team empowerment
Establish communities of practice for collaborative learning
Implement regular feedback mechanisms for leaders
Create more opportunities for direct customer interaction
Moderate Need: Focus on specific skill gaps identified in the assessment
Enhance decision-making frameworks to balance autonomy with alignment
Strengthen feedback loops with customers and teams
Improve transparency in goal-setting and progress tracking
Low Need: Refine existing agile practices and leadership approaches
Share best practices across the organization
Mentor emerging leaders in agile principles
Very Low Need: Focus on sustaining your strong agile leadership culture
Document and share your leadership practices with the wider community
Explore innovative ways to enhance your already strong foundation
Consider how your leadership approach can adapt to future challenges

primary_category.title: Agile Leadership
primary_category.description: The overall ability of leaders to foster agility, adaptability, and continuous improvement in fast-changing environments

high: Leaders struggle to adapt to changing circumstances
Teams lack autonomy to make decisions and innovate
medium: Some agile practices exist but aren't consistently applied
Leaders balance control with empowerment but could improve
low: Leaders effectively empower teams and embrace change
Organization demonstrates agility and customer focus

high: Invest in comprehensive agile leadership training
Create structures that encourage delegation and team autonomy
medium: Strengthen existing agile practices through targeted coaching
Identify and address specific barriers to greater agility
low: Share your effective practices with the wider organization
Focus on mentoring emerging leaders in agile principles

secondary_category.title: Adaptive Mindset
secondary_category.description: The ability of leaders to respond positively to change, uncertainty, and complexity

high: Leaders often resist change and prefer established methods
Organization struggles to adapt to shifting market conditions
medium: Leaders accept change but could improve response speed
Some flexibility exists but with attachment to existing plans
low: Leaders effectively navigate uncertainty and complexity
Organization demonstrates resilience in changing conditions

high: Focus on developing comfort with uncertainty through simulations
Establish shorter planning horizons and more frequent reassessment
medium: Practice scenario planning to improve adaptability
Implement more frequent review and adjustment cycles
low: Leverage your adaptive capabilities for competitive advantage
Mentor others in handling change effectively

report_structure.title: Agile Leadership Assessment Report
report_structure.description: A comprehensive analysis of your organization's agile leadership capabilities and specific recommendations for improvement

critical_focus.title: Priority Focus Areas
critical_focus.description: These areas require immediate attention for improvement

development_opportunities.title: Development Opportunities
development_opportunities.description: These areas present opportunities for improvement

implementation_strategy.title: Implementation Strategy
implementation_strategy.description: A structured approach to enhancing agile leadership capabilities
recommendations: Begin with leadership awareness sessions to build understanding and buy-in
Follow with hands-on workshops focused on practical application
Implement regular leadership retrospectives to drive continuous improvement
Establish mentoring relationships between experienced agile leaders and newcomers
Create communities of practice to sustain momentum and learning

support_resources.title: Support Resources
support_resources.description: Resources to help leaders develop agile capabilities
recommendations: Agile leadership coaching for executives and middle management
Online learning modules for self-paced development
Assessment tools to track progress over time
Case studies of successful agile transformations
Peer learning circles to share experiences and challenges

Category Name.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for this category}
Category Name.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for this category}
Category Name.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

Another Category.high: ${Replace with high priority recommendation for this category}
Another Category.medium: ${Replace with medium priority recommendation for this category}
Another Category.low: ${Replace with low priority recommendation for this category}

Adaptive Mindset.high: Develop comfort with uncertainty through shorter planning cycles and more frequent reassessment
Adaptive Mindset.medium: Enhance adaptability by practicing scenario planning and contingency development
Adaptive Mindset.low: Share your effective adaptation strategies across the organization

Team Empowerment.high: Implement clear decision-making frameworks that delegate appropriate authority to teams
Team Empowerment.medium: Expand team autonomy gradually in well-defined areas with clear guardrails
Team Empowerment.low: Mentor other leaders in effective team empowerment techniques

Continuous Improvement.high: Establish regular retrospectives focused on leadership practices and organizational learning
Continuous Improvement.medium: Strengthen existing improvement cycles with more rigorous follow-through on action items
Continuous Improvement.low: Develop advanced experimentation approaches to drive innovation

Value Delivery.high: Implement customer-focused metrics that prioritize outcomes over outputs
Value Delivery.medium: Refine value measurement approaches to better connect work to customer impact
Value Delivery.low: Share your effective value-driven practices with the wider organization

Transparency.high: Create structured information sharing practices that make goals, metrics, and challenges visible
Transparency.medium: Expand information sharing beyond immediate teams to the broader organization
Transparency.low: Explore advanced transparency practices that can further strengthen trust

Collaboration.high: Reorganize work around value streams rather than functional departments
Collaboration.medium: Reduce handoffs and approval processes that impede cross-functional collaboration
Collaboration.low: Mentor others in effective cross-functional leadership techniques

Customer Focus.high: Establish direct connections between leaders and customers through regular interaction
Customer Focus.medium: Strengthen existing customer feedback mechanisms with more frequent touchpoints
Customer Focus.low: Explore advanced customer research techniques to deepen understanding

Risk Management.high: Shift from risk avoidance to risk management through smaller experiments
Risk Management.medium: Balance risk mitigation with more rapid learning cycles
Risk Management.low: Share your effective risk management approaches with the broader organization

Agile Leadership.high: Consider a comprehensive agile leadership development program for key leaders
Agile Leadership.medium: Target specific agile leadership skills with the greatest improvement opportunity
Agile Leadership.low: Focus on sustaining and sharing your effective agile leadership practices

needLevel.label: There is a very high chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training
There is a high chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training
There is a moderate chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training
There is a low chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training
There is a very low chance your team could benefit from agile leadership training

summaries.text: Your organization shows significant opportunities for developing agile leadership capabilities. Leaders currently struggle with adapting to change, empowering teams, and maintaining customer focus. A comprehensive agile leadership development program would deliver substantial benefits.

Your organization demonstrates some agile leadership practices but has notable improvement opportunities. Enhancing leaders' abilities to empower teams, adapt to change, and maintain customer focus would strengthen organizational agility.

Your organization shows a moderate foundation in agile leadership with specific areas for targeted improvement. Focusing on these areas will help leaders better support team autonomy and adaptability.
Your organization demonstrates strong agile leadership capabilities with a few areas for refinement. Leaders generally empower teams effectively and adapt well to changing conditions.

Your organization exemplifies excellent agile leadership practices. Leaders effectively empower teams, adapt to change, maintain customer focus, and drive continuous improvement. Focus on sustaining these strengths and mentoring others.

thankYou.title: Thank You for Completing the Agile Leadership Assessment
thankYou.message: Your responses will help us evaluate if agile leadership training would benefit your organization. We'll analyze your results and provide tailored recommendations.
thankYou.nextSteps: You'll receive a detailed report shortly with analysis and specific recommendations for enhancing agile leadership capabilities in your organization.
